poem:
**Echoes of Conflict**

Amid the clang of distant tariffs,  
trumpets sound—a false harmony.  
Europe's leaders meet with shadows,  
while in Sweden, quiet souls  
bear silent wounds. Hear the cold  
silence where innocence dreams.  
A nameless ache stirs,  
as we hold our breath,  
waiting once more for the light.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘We will protect our interests, however and whenever needed’: EU’s von der Leyen responds to Trump tariff threats - Europe live 1.05pm GMT Five people affected by the school attack: Swedish police The latest update from the Swedish police talks about five people affected. We have no details on the extent of their injuries. We will bring you the latest when we have it and it comes from confirmed sources. 12.55pm GMT Swedish police responding". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘We will protect our interests, however and whenever needed’: EU’s von der Leyen responds to Trump tariff threats - Europe live 1.05pm GMT Five people affected by the school attack: Swedish police The latest update from the Swedish police talks about five people affected. We have no details on the extent of their injuries. We will bring you the latest when we have it and it comes from confirmed sources. 12.55pm GMT Swedish police responding
